CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bessie Patterson, 16 Tannehill Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" Answer reads: "In my opinion five days is enough for any child to spend in school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bessie Patterson wearing light colored coat with dark patterned scarf, leaning against wooden fence in front of parking lot
